bugs.title: CVE-2021-25287 python-pillow: out-of-bounds read in J2kDecode in j2ku_graya_la [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-25287 python-pillow: out-of-bounds read in J2kDecode in j2ku_graya_la [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-25287 python-pillow: Out-of-bounds read in J2K image reader

long_desc.thetext:
There is an out-of-bounds read in J2kDecode in j2ku_graya_la. For J2k images with multiple bands, itâ€™s legal to have different widths for each band, e.g. 1 byte for L, 4 bytes for A. This dates to Pillow 2.4.0.

References:
https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/stable/releasenotes/8.2.0.html#security
https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/5377

Created mingw-python-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958230]


Created python-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958228]


Created python2-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958227]


Created python3-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1958229]

Mitigation:

To mitigation this feature on Red Hat Quay keep the invoice generation feature disabled as it is by default.

Upstream patch:
https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/commit/3bf5eddb89afdf690eceaa52bc4d3546ba9a5f87

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2021:4149 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4149

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2021-25287

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-25288 python-pillow: Out-of-bounds read in J2K image reader

long_desc.thetext:
There is an out-of-bounds read in J2kDecode in j2ku_gray_i. For J2k images with multiple bands, itâ€™s legal to have different widths for each band, e.g. 1 byte for L, 4 bytes for A. This dates to Pillow 2.4.0.

References:
https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/stable/releasenotes/8.2.0.html#security
https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/5377

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958233]


Created python3-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1958234]

Mitigation:

To mitigate this feature on Red Hat Quay keep the invoice generation feature disabled, as it is by default.

Upstream patch:
https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/commit/3bf5eddb89afdf690eceaa52bc4d3546ba9a5f87

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-28675 python-pillow: Excessive memory allocation in PSD image reader

long_desc.thetext:
PsdImagePlugin.PsdImageFile did not sanity check the number of input layers with regard to the size of the data block, this could lead to a denial-of-service on open() prior to load(). This dates to the PIL fork.

References:
https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/stable/releasenotes/8.2.0.html#security
https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/5377

Created mingw-python-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958244]


Created python-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958241]


Created python2-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958242]


Created python3-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1958243]

Statement:

To mitigate this feature on Red Hat Quay keep the invoice generation feature disabled, as it is by default.

Upstream patch:
https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/commit/22e9bee4ef225c0edbb9323f94c26cee0c623497

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2021:4149 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4149

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2021-28675

bugs.title: CVE-2021-28675 mingw-python-pillow: python-pillow: DoS in PsdImagePlugin [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-28675 mingw-python-pillow: python-pillow: DoS in PsdImagePlugin [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-28675 python-pillow: Excessive memory allocation in PSD image reader

long_desc.thetext:
PsdImagePlugin.PsdImageFile did not sanity check the number of input layers with regard to the size of the data block, this could lead to a denial-of-service on open() prior to load(). This dates to the PIL fork.

https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/5377

bugs.title: CVE-2021-28676 python-pillow: infinite loop in FliDecode.c can lead to DoS [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-28676 python-pillow: infinite loop in FliDecode.c can lead to DoS [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-28676 python-pillow: Infinite loop in FLI image reader

long_desc.thetext:
FliDecode.c did not properly check that the block advance was non-zero, potentially leading to an infinite loop on load. This dates to the PIL fork.

References:
https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/stable/releasenotes/8.2.0.html#security
https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/5377

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958254]


Created python3-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1958255]

Mitigation:

To mitigate this feature on Red Hat Quay keep the invoice generation feature disabled, as it is by default.

Upstream patch:
https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/commit/bb6c11fb889e6c11b0ee122b828132ee763b5856

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

bugs.title: CVE-2021-28677 python-pillow: DoS in the open phase via a malicious EPS file [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-28677 python-pillow: DoS in the open phase via a malicious EPS file [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-28677 python-pillow: Excessive CPU use in EPS image reader

long_desc.thetext:
The readline used in EPS has to deal with any combination of \r and \n as line endings. It accidentally used a quadratic method of accumulating lines while looking for a line ending. A malicious EPS file could use this to perform a denial-of-service of Pillow in the open phase, before an image was accepted for opening. This dates to the PIL fork.

References:
https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/stable/releasenotes/8.2.0.html#security
https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/5377

Created mingw-python-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958261]


Created python-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958259]


Created python2-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958258]


Created python3-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1958260]

Mitigation:

To mitigate this feature on Red Hat Quay keep the invoice generation feature disabled, as it is by default.

Upstream patch:
https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/commit/5a5e6db0abf4e7a638fb1b3408c4e495a096cb92

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2021:4149 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4149

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2021-28677

bugs.title: CVE-2021-28678 python-pillow: improper check in BlpImagePlugin can lead to DoS [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-28678 python-pillow: improper check in BlpImagePlugin can lead to DoS [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-28678 python-pillow: Excessive looping in BLP image reader

long_desc.thetext:
BlpImagePlugin did not properly check that reads after jumping to file offsets returned data. This could lead to a denial-of-service where the decoder could be run a large number of times on empty data. This dates to Pillow 5.1.0.

References:
https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/stable/releasenotes/8.2.0.html#security
https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/5377

Created mingw-python-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958267]


Created python-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958264]


Created python2-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958265]


Created python3-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1958266]

Mitigation:

To mitigate this feature on Red Hat Quay keep the invoice generation feature disabled, as it is by default.

Upstream patch:
https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/5377/commits/496245aa4365d0827390bd0b6fbd11287453b3a1

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2021:4149 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4149

unstable_karma=-3

bugs.title: CVE-2021-28678 mingw-python-pillow: python-pillow: improper check in BlpImagePlugin can lead to DoS [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-28678 mingw-python-pillow: python-pillow: improper check in BlpImagePlugin can lead to DoS [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-28678 python-pillow: Excessive looping in BLP image reader

long_desc.thetext:
BlpImagePlugin did not properly check that reads after jumping to file offsets returned data. This could lead to a denial-of-service where the decoder could be run a large number of times on empty data. This dates to Pillow 5.1.0.

References:
https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/stable/releasenotes/8.2.0.html#security
https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/5377

Created mingw-python-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958267]


Created python-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958264]


Created python2-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1958265]


Created python3-pillow tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1958266]

Mitigation:

To mitigate this feature on Red Hat Quay keep the invoice generation feature disabled, as it is by default.

Upstream patch:
https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/pull/5377/commits/496245aa4365d0827390bd0b6fbd11287453b3a1

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2021:4149 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4149

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2021-28678

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

autokarma=True

unstable_karma=-3

close_bugs=True
